Posts.Content: I am new to this too and whilst I can’t comment or offer advice on your specific treatment I know the waiting is the hardest bit.  You’re in the right place this is a great forum with lots of lovely people offering words of encouragement. I’m sure someone will comment  I know how you feel it’s torture but what I’ve learnt in my short time is try to keep busy and set yourself short tasks that involve being with others. That time to forget just for a short while is therapy.  Sending you big hugs and positive thoughts  Xx
Posts.Title: A total mess

Posts.Content: I’m 3 sessions in and have had no real major side effects from FEC other than a mild case of constipation so have something at the ready.  For me it’s the injections after that wipe me out. All but useless. After the first one I wake the following morning with what feels like I’ve done 10 rounds with Tyson. Tiredness like I’m jet lagged but after 48 hours I’m getting back into the swing of things. I also struggle with weird headaches, not your usual headache but I’m convinced that’s the chemo and hair thing.  I have POM juice but do take the sickness even if you feel ok as it does creep up on you.  Listen to your body and don’t fight it.  I’ve got used to doing things when I can but accepting that it’s ok to sleep ALOT  Good luck, hope like me you your not too affected.  Xx
Posts.Title: FEC first one done

Posts.Content: Thank you. I hadn’t figured it could get uncomfortable or even painful. I have a very short haircut but longish fringe.  Maybe I’ll be bold in a few days and go for it.
Posts.Title: Coming to terms with hair loss.

Posts.Content: My nurse told me hair loss would be imminent but after two weeks since chemo I thought I’m going to be that one person that keeps it. What a fool.  This morning it’s started. I have short hair but it’s still scary.  My question to you all, is did you wait or did you bite the bullet and shave it off?
Posts.Title: Coming to terms with hair loss.

Posts.Content: 3 sessions in an I’m almost bald. But still shampoo my head every day, how bonkers is that!  Xx
Posts.Title: *** April 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Concepta  I am exactly the same, two rounds done, round 3 next week. It’s the injections that get me post chemo. I’m in a daze for a good 36 hours and sleep so much. Feel like I’ve done a massive work out. Limbs ache and am zapped of energy.  Like you I’m thinking it’s going to come but they did say you might breeze through it or it could hit you hard further in but for now I’ll thank my lucky stars it’s going just fine.  Xx
